item.title: Crossing red line in geopolitics
item.description: THE term red line has been used in a number of contexts over the years. A geopolitical ‘red line’ is a non-negotiable boundary or action that, if crossed by an adversary, will trigger a specified and severe response — whether diplomatic, economic or military. A country draws a red line to maintain the status quo and to prevent a negative change. Understanding the......

item.title: Justice elusive for Felani, zero-death promises unmet
item.description: FIFTEEN years after the killing of Felani Khatun, justice remains elusive, bringing forth a grim continuity of impunity that Indian border guards have enjoyed. On January 7, 2011, the image of the 15-year-old girl’s bullet-hit body hanging from a barbed-wire fence stunned people. This was not merely the evidence of a killing. It also became a searing indictment of India’s lethal......

item.title: Year of chances missed, hopes dashed in health sector
item.description: THE year 2025 was a year of chances that the interim government, which assumed office on August 8, 2024 after the fall of the Awami League government three days earlier amid the July uprising, missed out on.
